title: The Sociolinguistic analysis of Makassarese honorific system
abstract: The title of this research is the honorific system in Makassarese. The primary aim of this research is to describe words, phrases, sentences, idiomatic expressions and other linguistic forms that indicate the use of honorific system in Makassarese. In this research, the writer applied the qualitative approach because the writer intended to find out what, honorific terms and how they are used in Makassarese. The writer used two kinds of research, the field research in which she directly collected her data from her informants, and the library research in which she collected her data from various kinds of book / document. After the data were classified and described, the writer found the following findings : 51 items of honorific terms; 9 terms of bound morphemes, 31 terms of words, 5 terms of idiomatic expressions and 6 terms of kelong and tne code-mixing and they all presented in 16 tables. The findings and analysis prove that there is honorific system in Makassarese, and there are many reasons that make people to use honorific terms to their addressees, and it dues to the differences in age, status, nobility and so on. Besides, the philosophy of Sirik na the Makassarese people influence them to have honorific system.
